pullRequest.body:
This will be used to show a representation independent characterization of standard smoothness.

---

if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [70782a7a2a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21037/commits/70782a7a2ac79e582aaaa0029bfe8a44c7faf678)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.CotangentLocalizationAway` (new file)|1426|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.Algebra.Generators.ker_localizationAway`
`+ compLocalizationAwayAlgHom`
`+ compLocalizationAwayAlgHom_X_inl`
`+ compLocalizationAwayAlgHom_relation_eq_zero`
`+ compLocalizationAwayAlgHom_toAlgHom_toComp`
`+ comp_localizationAway_ker`
`+ injective_of_map_eq`
`+ injective_of_map_zero`
`+ ker_comp_eq_sup`
`+ liftBaseChange_injective_of_isLocalizationAway`
`+ map_ofComp_ker`
`+ sq_ker_comp_le_ker_compLocalizationAwayAlgHom`
`+ toAlgHom_ofComp_surjective`
`- Cotangent.map_ofComp_ker`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

```suggestion
    compLocalizationAwayAlgHom T g P (((localizationAway g (S := T)).toComp P).toAlgHom x) =
```

```suggestion
lemma compLocalizationAwayAlgHom_X_inl : compLocalizationAwayAlgHom T g P (X (Sum.inl ())) =
```

```suggestion
        Ideal.span {rename Sum.inr f * X (Sum.inl ()) - 1} := by
```
Does this not work?

```suggestion
    compLocalizationAwayAlgHom T g P (rename Sum.inr (P. g) * X (Sum.inl ()) - 1) = 0 := by
```
I don't think `J` is defined anywhere else? And I think we should also copy the definition of `I` (or the whole setting) here.
Are you planning to add more results to this file? I don't think this file currently imports the Jacobi-Zariski file.
This should be a separate lemma.
I changed the spelling of a `private` lemma and use that here now.

If you add
```
lemma ofComp_toAlgHom_rename_inr (P : Generators R S) (Q : Generators S T) (p : P.Ring) :
    (Q.ofComp P).toAlgHom (rename Sum.inr p) = C (algebraMap _ _ p) :=
  have : (Q.ofComp P).toAlgHom.comp (rename Sum.inr) =
    (IsScalarTower.toAlgHom R S Q.Ring).comp (IsScalarTower.toAlgHom R P.Ring S) := by ext; simp
  DFunLike.congr_fun this p
```
and make `localzationAway` reducible
Then this proof becomes
```
    rw [ker_localizationAway, Ideal.map_span, Set.image_singleton, map_sub, map_mul, map_one,
      Hom.toAlgHom_X, ofComp_toAlgHom_rename_inr, h]
    rfl
```
I think we should do the `reducible` change more consistently and benchmark the effects instead of changing it here ad-hoc.

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/Cotangent): `liftBaseChange` is injective for localizations
